newsitem.title: POLAND: Merrill Lynch advises adding to Polish portfolio.
newsitem.headline: Merrill Lynch advises adding to Polish portfolio.

text.p: Merrill Lynch said in a report dated October 30 it was advising investors to take advantage of the recent Warsaw bourse slide and accumulate Polish stocks as the overall climate is positive for the exchange.
"The recent 17 percent fall in Warsaw share prices provides investors with a timely opportunity to add to Polish positions as the medium and long term prospects of the market remain strong," it said.
It said a rebound in Germany and increasing 1997 growth rates in Russia might balance out the effect of a stronger currency.
The main market's all-share WIG index closed at 13,716.3 points on Tuesday, 9.9 percent lower than its October 9 high.
Merrill Lynch particularly recommended investors adding to positions in Elektrim, BIG and Polifarb Cieszyn.

Merrill Lynch said that although the parliamentary move to reduce next year's income tax levels raised concerns about 1997 inflation targets, Poland remained a growth leader in Eastern Europe. -- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
